page.title: 20Newspapers in Banbury
page.content:
As well as all the usual daily newspapers, there are three local weekly newspapers in Banbury. There are two free newspapers which are delivered to every house on Wednesday or Thursday. These are the Banbury Cake and the Banbury Focus. The one you have to pay for is the Banbury Guardian. It usually has about 48 pages, half of them adverts, and it costs 16p.
Both of the schools which have written these twenty pages for the Domesday Project have produced their own school newspapers just for the children in the school to read. The schools are Queensway and Dashwood. They are both primary schools and children in the upper junior classes worked with their teachers on this project in Summer 1985.
